comment.author: 71217563@N07
comment._content: www.britmedals.co.uk/shop.asp?pid=4665 His Memorial Plaque is for sale. So sad.

comment.author: 72133717@N05
comment._content: Acording to the 1901 Census Edgar R Seabury was born in 1899 at Nettswell, Essex. In 1901 he was living at Burnt Mill, Nettswell with his father Edward, who was a Marine Engineer Manager, his mother Emily, Brother Harold and two sisters Dorothy and Gladys. There was also a servant Ethel Gunn. By the 1911 Census the family had moved to Albert Villa, Broxbourne, Hertfordshire. His father was now a works manager general engineering. His mother had died and Gladys was now the only other child living at home. There was also a domestic servant Lilian Hills

comment.author: 110707150@N03
comment._content: Edgar was a distant relative of mine. My great granny was a Seabury from Shropshire, which is where Edgar's father came from. Emily (Waite) - Edgars mother, was not Edward first wife. He had been married before to Sarah Downes and they had a family in the north of England. I cannot find any evidence that Edward and Emily were married at all, but they had many children, including Edgar.
